attributes.action: Provide relief to those in the catering industry that were exempt from schemes
attributes.additional_details: As stated in 2018, "the catering industry is thriving in the UK, with revenue for the market sitting at £1bn" according to IBISWorld. This is a huge part of the hospitality sector, yet caterers were left in the dark, with only the self-employment grant to tide them over and pay furloughed workers. Large events that require outside catering have had to stop, as numbers are limited, meaning business has dropped to 0 for many in the industry, leaving businesses and owners at breaking point.
attributes.background: Many caterers have felt totally excluded from the "Help Out To Eat Out" scheme, rates relief, grants, and further assistance from the government, as they do not have a physical premises, yet still have to furlough their workers in a time where business has dramatically dropped.
